metadata.category: Core ML Image Classification App Challenge
metadata.title: Introduction to Core ML & On-Device ML

inlineContent.text: Understand Apple’s machine learning framework Core ML,
and learn about the benefits and use cases of on-device AI.

sections.title: Introduction to Core ML & On-Device ML

inlineContent.text: Three Key Benefits of On-Device ML
Understanding Core ML Architecture
Core ML automatically optimizes usage across
the Neural Engine, GPU, and CPU. Developers don’t need
to worry about hardware details.
Supported Model Types
Core ML is Apple’s
on-device machine learning framework
announced at WWDC 2017.
By running ML models on the device itself rather than a server,
it provides benefits in privacy, speed, and offline support.
Create a new iOS App project in Xcode.
Product Name:
ImageClassifier
Interface:
SwiftUI
Language:
Swift
Set up the basic UI structure.
Create a screen that selects images from the camera/photo library
and displays classification results.
Download a Core ML model.
Get MobileNetV2 from Apple Developer
and add it to your project.
Create a Core ML project in Xcode
and set up the basic structure.
What is the most significant advantage of on-device ML?
Privacy — Data never leaves the device
The core value of on-device ML is privacy.
Even sensitive data (faces, health info) can be processed securely.
Can run more powerful models than servers
Actually, servers are more powerful.
The advantages of on-device ML are privacy, speed, and offline support.
Development is easier
Development difficulty is similar.
The core values of on-device ML are privacy and speed.
Core ML automatically selects between Neural Engine,
GPU, and CPU based on the model and device conditions.
Neural Engine, GPU, and CPU — all of them
Core ML prioritizes Neural Engine or GPU when possible
to maximize performance.
CPU only
Core ML automatically selects the optimal hardware.
Developers don’t need to worry about hardware details.
Developer must specify manually
What hardware does Core ML automatically optimize to use?

to recognize different types of sounds.
